intro: Lasianthus venulosus, commonly known as the veiny lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and are arranged in spikes, adding ornamental value to gardens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded environments.
